intro: Siparuna eriocalyx, commonly known as the velvetleaf siphonostemon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid lowland forests. Siparuna eriocalyx is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
